humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: According to the pathology report, there is 1 out of 15 lymph nodes positive for metastatic carcinoma. Based on the AJCC staging system, this corresponds to N1 (Rule 12: N1 indicates metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes). The report also mentions that a large lymph node was reprocessed and found to be negative for malignancy, but this does not change the fact that at least one lymph node was positive, so the N stage remains N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for staging of cancer is determined by the involvement of regional lymph nodes. In this report, the mastectomy specimen of the left breast shows that 1 out of 15 lymph nodes is positive for metastatic carcinoma. Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.
